Hi Jared,
you can add (link) folders to a project from anywhere if you right-klick a 
project in the navigator, call properties->Java BuildPath-Tab->Source, if u now 
create a new folder, klick on the advance button and u can link the logical 
folder to any "real" folder from your directory structure (we need this to 
create multiple projects for one source-directory). So logical the folder is 
below your project folder, but still resides outside in the filesystem ... 

[...]
  Java (non-linked folder)
    build (folder linked to build)
       build.xml (visible, cos it's in the buildpath) 
    src (folder linked to src)
       com
           media_saturn
    classes (folder linked to classes)
    project (non-linked folder)
      eclipse2.1 (non-linked folder with project contents)
        .project (non-linked file)
        .classpath (non-linked file)
        
... hope it's clear now.
regards,

jochen
